subject: Decisions and Verdicts
Murders and Attempted Murders
lead_paragraph: A onetime Penn State football player was convicted of murder for stabbing a student to death in what prosecutors said was a crime driven by a desperate need for money.LaVon Chisley Jr., 23, was found guilty by a jury Friday of first- and third-degree murder. He was immediately sentenced to life in prison. Centre County prosecutors said Chisley stabbed Langston Carraway, a 26-year-old Penn State senior, 93 times in June 2006.
